divs: sighting detailsleaving for work ( midnight shift ) @ aprox 9:20 p.m. i observed a large bright star like light in the north sky. this would place the object north of brown city between marlette and sandusky mi \ the sky was clear with normal stars visable in the night sky \ the brightness and size of the object was what cought my attention \ the color was more yellow than what a star would be \ it also had a sharp outline or edge \ light was bright and did not pulse \ light was fixed and did not look to be moving \ this was observed for aprox. 3 sec before light slowly dimed out \ apox. 60 sec. later a light rose from ground level getting brighter as it rose to apox. two hands high from horizon \ it then came to a stop getting as bright as the previously observed light for apox 2 sec. \ the light then turned into a three branched capitol t shape star burst fading away \ it took this light apox 3 sec. to rise from ground level to were it stopped \ its color was the same yellow as the first light \ it also was a steady light and did not pulse like a firework or flare
Summary: Light's in sky between marlette and sandusky MI
